pullrequest.title: Added a few common doxygen files

content.raw: Just to make sure I'm following correctly, is `doc/cppreference.tag.xml` a file that's provided by cppreference.com? And we're installing it to ensure that that the STL objects which we use will get tagged so that they link to cppreference.com? Looking at `doc/cppreference.tag.xml`, I see that there's an `anchorfile` element, and their paths seem to match the ones used by `cppreference.com`, but I don't see any way for the tag to ultimately link to the `cppreference.com` URL (i.e. how would doxygen know the root website?). Maybe I'm just overlooking something.
content.html: Just to make sure I'm following correctly, is doc/cppreference.tag.xml a file that's provided by cppreference.com? And we're installing it to ensure that that the STL objects which we use will get tagged so that they link to cppreference.com? Looking at doc/cppreference.tag.xml, I see that there's an anchorfile element, and their paths seem to match the ones used by cppreference.com, but I don't see any way for the tag to ultimately link to the cppreference.com URL (i.e. how would doxygen know the root website?). Maybe I'm just overlooking something.
